Description: Calcite fragment: this slightly curved piece of calcite is incised with the prenomen and nomen of Ramses III and the edge of the 'serekh'. It may have come from the side of a basin or altar. The piece is broken with the loss of half the nomen, most of the prenomen and the entire Horus name. The surface is damaged on the right side and bottom. There are no traces of colour.
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1982 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 10. (pl.28)
Condition: Fair (incomplete). The surface is damaged on the right side and bottom.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
Additional IDs: Other BM number: EA878 (original Big Number)
